original_solution_mapping.L1: Bertha wears out 20 / 10 = <<20/10=2>>2 tennis balls in 20 games.
original_solution_mapping.L2: She loses 20 / 5 = <<20/5=4>>4 tennis balls in 20 games.
original_solution_mapping.L3: She buys canisters of 3 * 20 / 4 = <<3*20/4=15>>15 tennis balls in 20 games.
original_solution_mapping.L4: Bertha started with 2 balls and gave 1 away, so she has 2 + 15 - 2 - 4 - 1 = <<2+15-2-4-1=10>>10 tennis balls after twenty games.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 2965.
    Returns: the number of tennis balls Bertha has after twenty games.
    """
    # L1
    total_games = 20 # After twenty games
    wear_out_frequency = 10 # Every ten games, one of her tennis balls wears out
    balls_worn_out = total_games / wear_out_frequency

    # L2
    lose_frequency = 5 # Every five games, she loses a ball
    balls_lost = total_games / lose_frequency

    # L3
    balls_per_canister = 3 # canister of three balls
    buy_frequency = 4 # Every four games, she buys a canister
    balls_bought = balls_per_canister * total_games / buy_frequency

    # L4
    initial_balls = 2 # She started with two balls
    given_away = 1 # gave one to her partner
    remaining_balls = initial_balls + balls_bought - balls_worn_out - balls_lost - given_away

    # FA
    answer = remaining_balls
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Bertha wears out {total_games} / {wear_out_frequency} = <<{total_games}/{wear_out_frequency}={balls_worn_out}>>{balls_worn_out} tennis balls in {total_games} games.
She loses {total_games} / {lose_frequency} = <<{total_games}/{lose_frequency}={balls_lost}>>{balls_lost} tennis balls in {total_games} games.
She buys canisters of {balls_per_canister} * {total_games} / {buy_frequency} = <<{balls_per_canister}*{total_games}/{buy_frequency}={balls_bought}>>{balls_bought} tennis balls in {total_games} games.

Bertha started with {initial_balls} balls and gave {given_away} away, so she has {initial_balls} + {balls_bought} - {balls_worn_out} - {balls_lost} - {given_away} = <<{initial_balls}+{balls_bought}-{balls_worn_out}-{balls_lost}-{given_away}={remaining_balls}>>{remaining_balls} tennis balls after twenty games.
